alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; South Central Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 07 at 3:06AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Multiple weather disturbances to bring colder temperatures, snow showers, and gusty winds... A weather disturbance will bring wetter weather across and north of the US Highway 50 corridor today. Breezy to locally windy west to southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph are possible. In addition, colder air will be over the area with highs in the 30s to low 40s with a mix of light rain and snow showers today, with a changeover to all snow tonight. Limited accumulations of less than a half inch is expected in the valleys with one to two inches in the mountains. A stronger weather feature will bring better chances for accumulating snow to valleys across central and northeastern Nevada late tonight through Friday morning. Snow amounts of one half inch with isolated areas of 2 inches are expected. Probability of greater than 2 inches (greater than 70%) is concentrated around the northern Elko county mountains, areas adjacent to the Ruby mountains and along I-80 between Elko and Wells. Since snow is expected overnight, potential for some impacts on roadways increases, particularly by Friday morning. Drier conditions return for Friday evening before light snow showers arrives to northern Nevada for the weekend. Much colder temperatures are expected Saturday morning with readings in the single digits to teens. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
